message_1: Let's say there are two propositions P and Q. P is true 80% of the time, while Q is true 60% of the time. What is the probability that both propositions P and Q are true at the same time?
message_2:
To find the probability that both propositions P and Q are true at the same time, we can simply multiply their individual probabilities together, assuming that they are independent events.

Probability(P and Q) = Probability(P) * Probability(Q)

Probability(P and Q) = 0.8 * 0.6

Probability(P and Q) = 0.48

So, the probability that both propositions P and Q are true at the same time is 48%.
